data.title: The top 20 German publications every start
data.meta_description: We have curated a comprehensive list of the top 20 most influential and informative media outlets in Germany for young founders and technology enthusiasts. These authoritative and insightful media outlets offer unparalleled coverage of the latest trends, news, and developments in the fields of tech
data.text:
Did you know that Germany ranks among the top 10 countries in the world for innovation? Germany has long been recognized as a hub for innovation and technological advancements, and its extensive media landscape plays a vital role in shaping the nation's business and tech landscape. From traditional print media to cutting-edge digital platforms, the country boasts a diverse range of media outlets catering to the needs of its vibrant and dynamic business community. With a plethora of options to choose from, selecting the right media outlets can be a daunting task, particularly for non-native speakers of the German language.

To address this challenge, we have curated a comprehensive list of the top 20 most influential and informative media outlets in Germany for young founders and technology enthusiasts. These authoritative and insightful media outlets offer unparalleled coverage of the latest trends, news, and developments in the fields of tech and business, making them indispensable resources for anyone looking to stay up-to-date with the rapidly evolving business landscape in Germany. Whether you are an aspiring entrepreneur or a seasoned business leader, these media outlets will provide you with the information and insights you need to succeed in the highly competitive German market. So without further ado, here are the top 20 publications and media outlets every start-up should know about.

1. brand eins

Despite being relatively less established than its American counterpart, the German edition of this esteemed business magazine is nonetheless deserving of recognition. Potential contributors are advised to submit detailed and comprehensive stories related to finance, media, technology, or other industry sectors to the German editors. Although the team may be comparatively small, they remain eager to secure exclusive content. Launched in Germany in 2015, and headquartered in Berlin, Business Insider Germany is known for its in-depth reporting, analysis, and commentary on the latest trends and developments in the world of business. Owned by Axel Springer SE, one of Europe's largest media companies, Business Insider Germany has a team of journalists and contributors based in Germany and around the world, producing content in German for its readershipâ€”content which gets noticed by over 10 million online visitors each month.

3. Business Punk

The online version of Der Spiegel is one of the most widely read news portals in Germany, with a monthly traffic of over 79 million visits each month. It evolved from Spiegel ONLINE, which was initially separated from the print version of Der Spiegel. However, as of 2020, both media divisions are published under the same name and corporate design. Der Spiegel has been an integral part of German history since its founding in 1947, and is known for its comprehensive coverage of national and international issues. Being featured in Der Spiegel can bring significant exposure, as it is a widely respected and influential publication in Germany.

7. deutsche startups

DIE ZEIT is an esteemed weekly newspaper and a vital media outlet in Germany, renowned for its independent and liberal stance on political issues. The publication covers a wide range of topics related to social life and current events from around the world. Being featured in DIE ZEIT guarantees a broad readership throughout the country. The newspaper's online presence is also substantial, with over 49 million monthly visits to its website. According to the German circulation audit bureau, DIE ZEIT had an average print circulation of 621,365 copies per issue in the third quarter of 2022. The publication is well-known for its feuilleton and politics sections. However, its digital and ZEIT Campus sections are also strong, making it attractive to startups.

Founded in 1946, Die Welt is a national daily newspaper based in Berlin, and is considered one of the country's leading newspapers. The newspaper has a dedicated business section, which covers topics such as finance, markets, industry trends, and features analysis and opinion pieces from leading experts in the field. The newspaper has a reputation for providing insightful analysis of factors driving economic growth and development in Germany and Europe, as well as the challenges facing businesses and investors. As a result, Die Welt is a widely read and respected source of information for business leaders, investors, and policymakers in Germany. It often features articles on successful start-ups, and prominent figures in the start-up world. As of 2022, Die Welt had a daily circulation of around 180,000 copies, with 760,00 readers. The newspaper also has a strong online presence, attracting over 80 million visitors each month.

10. GrÃ¼nderszene

GrÃ¼nderszene is a leading online magazine in Germany that provides extensive coverage of the start-up scene and digital economy. Its comprehensive content includes news, stories, video streams, opinion pieces, analyses, investigative stories, and background articles. With over 10 million visitors every month, GrÃ¼nderszene has a wide reach and also collaborates with various media outlets, such as DIE WELT and Berliner Wirtschaft. This collaboration has the potential to amplify the impact of start-up news published on GrÃ¼nderszene. Additionally, GrÃ¼nderszene is affiliated with NGIN Food and NGIN Mobility, two online publications which focus on the food tech industry and mobility topics respectively.

11. Handelsblatt

manager magazin is a German business magazine that focuses on economics and management. It was founded in 1971 and is published by the Hamburg-based Spiegel Group. The magazine covers a range of topics related to business and management, including corporate strategy, finance, leadership, entrepreneurship, and innovation. It also publishes rankings and profiles of companies, executives, and business leaders. manager magazin is known for its in-depth reporting and analysis, and it has won several awards for its journalism. The magazine has a reputation for being a reliable source of information for decision-makers in the business world. The online version of their publications attracts 3.6 million monthly readers, making it one of the most significant outlets in Germany. However, itâ€™s important to note that they do not cover start-ups.

16. Startbase

Startbase is a platform with a dedicated goal of positioning Germany as a leading nation for start-ups. Startbase functions as a centralized platform that provides a comprehensive overview of the scene. It facilitates networking among participants in the ecosystem, improves accessibility to information, and enhances visibility for German start-ups both nationally and internationally. This increased visibility leads to better access to innovations for investors and medium-sized companies. Moreover, the importance of the start-up ecosystem is clearly communicated through society and politics, highlighting its potential to drive the future economic success of Germany.

17. t3n

t3n is a prominent German media outlet that provides comprehensive coverage of various digital topics, including e-business, start-ups, social media, computer games, and web design. With over 2.8 million monthly online visitors, t3n is considered the leading publication for all things digital in Germanyâ€”and that's not even counting its print readership. Notably, several prominent media outlets such as Spiegel Online, Zeit Online, and Die Welt have featured t3n content in their publications, resulting in widespread media coverage. Additionally, t3n hosts its own podcast, which discusses pertinent topics surrounding the digital economy and society, as well as the Pioneers Network, an online platform aimed at fostering collaboration and innovation within the digital economy.

18. WirtschaftsWoche

WirtschaftsWoche is a highly regarded and influential business journal in Germany that has a strong focus on economics, finance, and business topics. Published once a week by the Handelsblatt publishing group, it has a circulation of approximately half a million print copies and 6 million online readers per month, making it one of the most widely read business publications in the country.

Being featured in WirtschaftsWoche can provide a significant boost for businesses and individuals, as it signals a high level of success and recognition in the German business world. With its wide readership and reputation for quality reporting, the publication is a valuable platform for professionals and businesses looking to expand their reach and influence in the German market.

19. WiWo GrÃ¼nder

WirtschaftsWoche (WiWo) GrÃ¼nder is a subsidiary website of WirtschaftsWocheâ€”Germany's leading business journal. The website offers a variety of startup-related publications, including news, analysis, information articles, and tips on the most important topics related to the startup scene. WiWo GrÃ¼nder is aimed at founders, investors, and anyone interested in starting a business by providing insights from the initial idea to financing possibilities and market entry. WiWo GrÃ¼nder is an essential resource for anyone interested in the German start-up scene. Its publications are read by a wide range of stakeholders in the startup ecosystem, making it a valuable platform for startups looking to connect with potential investors, partners, and customers.

20. W&V

W&V (Werben und Verkaufen), is a weekly B2B print publication that focuses on the communications and media industry. It covers international and German marketing, advertising, media, digital, and social media topics, providing news and background stories. The magazine is published by the Werben und Verkaufen media group, which is part of SÃ¼ddeutsche Zeitung, and has a circulation of 20,060 copies per week, making it one of the largest B2B print publications for media and marketing in Europe. W&V is in line with similar magazines such as "Marketing Week" in the UK, "AdAge" in the US, or "CB News" in France. Its readership includes professionals from agencies, media companies, and marketing departments across various industries. The website has more than 250,000 online visits per month, making it a valuable resource for professionals seeking the latest news, trends, and insights in the media and marketing industry.

Empower yourself with insight

Staying up-to-date with the latest developments and trends in the German business and tech landscape is crucial for any aspiring entrepreneur or business leader. The publications and media outlets listed above offer a wealth of information and insights that can help young founders and technology enthusiasts make informed decisions and stay ahead of the curve. With their diverse range of topics and comprehensive coverage, these media outlets provide invaluable resources that can benefit anyone looking to start a business or advance their career in the German market.

By leveraging the insights and knowledge provided by these media outlets, young founders and business leaders can gain a deeper understanding of the German business and tech landscape, and make informed decisions that can help them succeed in the highly competitive market. So why not start exploring these media outlets today and take your business or career to the next level!
